conclusion: Analysis of self-locking mechanism in classroom door lock.
Understanding the problem: spring-loaded latch mechanism, inclination angle θ = 30°, dynamic friction coefficient μ, spring compressed by distance x.
Setting up the force analysis: analyze forces acting on latch D at contact point P.
Forces acting on the latch: spring force F_s = kx, normal force F_N, friction force F_f = μF_N.
Force balance in self-locking state: horizontal components of forces preventing retraction must overcome spring force.
Critical condition for self-locking: F_N(sinθ + μcosθ) = kx.
Calculating the normal force: F_N = kx/(sin(30°) + μcos(30°)).
Final answer: normal force F_N = kx/(0.5 + 0.866μ).
